metadata.title: CVE-2020-11735 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
The private-key operations in ecc.c in wolfSSL before 4.4.0 do not use aconstant-time modular inverse when mapping to affine coordinates, aka a"projective coordinates leak."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl32 - 4.4.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0+dfsg-2').
